sorcer.core.provider

Class ProviderDelegate

  • java.lang.Object
    • sorcer.core.provider.ProviderDelegate

  • public class ProviderDelegate
extends Object
    There are two types of SORCER service servers: generic service servers - subclasses of ServiceExerter - and service beans - subclasses of sorcer.core.provider.bean.ExerterBean. Service beans use the Rio provisioning framework to be deployed in Rio cybernodes. This class does the actual work for both generic SORCER servers and SORCER service beans. Also it provides the basic functionality for Providers. Multiple SORECER exerters can be deployed within a single (@link ServiceProvider}.
    See Also:
    sorcer.sorcer.core.provider.exerter.ServiceExerter, ServiceProvider, sorcer.core.provider.bean.ProviderBean

      • getProperties

        public List<Object> getProperties()

      • getAttributes

        public Entry[] getAttributes()
        Creates the service attributes to be used with Jini lookup services.

        This function will create the following entries:

        • A Name.
        • A SorcerServiceInfoentry with all the information about this provider.
        • A main UIDescriptor if the provider overrides
        • Extra lookup attributes set via #addExtraLookupAttribute(Entry) ServiceExerter#getMainUIDescriptor().
        Returns:
        an array of Jini Service Entries.
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException

      • restore

        public void restore()
        Restores the ServiceID from SorcerConstants.S_SERVICE_ID_FILENAME .

        Please note: There is currently no method to save the ServiceID. So this method should probably be reworked.

      • getProxy

        public Remote getProxy()
        Returns a proxy object for this provider. If the smart proxy is alocated then returns a non exported object to be registerd with loookup services. However, if a smart proxy implements OuteProxy then the provider's proxy is set as its inner proxy. Otherwise the Remote outer proxy of this provider is returned.
        Returns:
        a proxy, or null
        See Also:
        Provider.getProxy()
